letter: letters are still a viable option for sending messages, and while it may take longer than electronic communication, it is still a reliable way to contact someone in another country.
phone call: although electronic communication has made it easier to call people from other countries, a phone call can still be done using landline or mobile phone.
email: email is another reliable way to communicate with someone in another country, and while it may not be as fast as electronic communication, it is still a viable option.
travel: if all electronic communication were to cease, the best way to contact someone in another country would be to travel there and meet them in person.
use a pigeon: although it may seem like a joke, pigeons are still a viable option for sending messages, and they can be used to send messages to other countries.
